Teltoli swallowed hard at Carnage's words. She looked at the soil, 
tears stringing at her eyes. 

Damn those automatic tear ducts. She couldn't cry now! Not in front 
of someone! Her father had always given her hell for even -looking- 
sad.

She blinked them away angrily, and looked back up. "Okay fine, I'm 
selfish. I can't be trusted. I am totally dishonost" Her voice 
carried undercurrents of hopelessness. "Is that what you want to 
hear?"

Her voice cracked at the last sentence. She couldn't believe she was 
argueing with Carnage! This couldn't be happening. 

But in the back of her mind, something nagged at her. This anger 
hadn't all come from her just leaving. Well, yes, quite a lot of it 
was aimed at her, but there had to be something else. Maybe she 
shouldn't ask..

"And no, I don't think it's right to leave someone behind. Okay, 
fine, so you won't forgive me. I've said I'm sorry, and that's all I 
can do, short of making it up to you. Tell me what I can do to make 
it up, and I'll do it. Anything, I don't care. Grovel, Go up against 
the Pred army, anything. Please Carnage, I want to be friends again 
but we can't be friends again like this"

Depressed. That was the only word that sprang to mind when she tried 
to think about herself. Wow, she hadn't felt that emotion in.. ages. 
Teltoli found herself wishing that a huge big hole would come up and 
pull her into it, but she had to face this.
